title.narrative: PNG Transport - RoU AusAID and Infrastructure

description.narrative: In November 2009, the Australia and Papua New Guinea (PNG) governments signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to: (1) encourage cooperation between the two countries in relation to the safety and security of the transport network including air, maritime and road; and (2) develop relations between transport portfolio agencies and relevant industry participants and other organisations concerned with the safety and security of the transport network. This initiative will support implementation of the MoU by providing grant funding directly to the Australian Department of Infrastructure, Transport, Regional Development and Local Government to deliver pre-approved projects based on work plans jointly developed by PNG and Australian transport agencies. The total value of this initiative is $3.0 million over 4 years, starting 2009-10.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
